page.title: 12HOME LIFE
page.content: The cost of living in this area is considered to be high with the cost of housing being among the highest in the country.The local paper reports that in the first six months of 1985 the cost of housing has risen 6.3% and that from now on they expect an annual increase of around 6%. On average a semi detatched three bedroomed home would cost Â£45000+ and a detached house at least Â£75000.Most families seem to have two cars. A small family car would cost approx Â£2000+ and a larger car Â£4000+.Children generally wear some sort of school uniform to school and a winter outfit of skirt, shirt,and outdoor coat for a girl would cost approx Â£31, and leather shoes for boys or girls at least another Â£12.Bus and train fares into Maidenhead cost about 50p, and petrol costs around 40p per litre.
